meanings.definition: A type of bond or promissory note issued by a corporation or government to secure a loan.
meanings.sent1: The company issued a debenture to raise funds for its new project.
meanings.sent2: Investors purchased debentures from the government to support infrastructure development.
meanings.sent3: The debenture decided to take a vacation in the filing cabinet.
meanings.sent4: Her commitment to the debenture was as strong as steel.
meanings.sent5: The debenture fluttered in the wind, a symbol of financial security.

meanings.definition: A certificate of indebtedness acknowledging a debt.
meanings.sent1: He proudly displayed the debenture as proof of his loan repayment.
meanings.sent2: The debenture was framed and hung on the wall as a reminder of financial responsibility.
meanings.sent3: The debenture blushed when it realized it was the center of attention.
meanings.sent4: Her debenture of gratitude towards him was evident in her smile.
meanings.sent5: The debenture gleamed under the light, a testament to financial trustworthiness.
